lead_paragraph: ALBANY, March 25 -- Senator Marshall to-day suffered the most crushing defeat of the session on his bill to amend the labor law so as to permit women over twenty-one years of age to work in factories at night. The bill in its original form raised the number of hours women might work in a day, but this provision was stricken out.

snippet: The wirephoto showed a couple of blurred male faces in the background -- Boris Yeltsin and Mikhail Gorbachev, in their funereal dark suits and ties -- while in the forefront, Sazhi Umalatova, 37, a deputy elected by the angry citizens of Chechen-I...
lead_paragraph: The wirephoto showed a couple of blurred male faces in the background -- Boris Yeltsin and Mikhail Gorbachev, in their funereal dark suits and ties -- while in the forefront, Sazhi Umalatova, 37, a deputy elected by the angry citizens of Chechen-Ingush, a bright knitted jacket on her broad shoulders, lashed into the man at the top. "You do not have the right to lead the country," she said. "You brought devastation, hunger, cold, blood, tears." The defiant woman from the Caucasus answered the Soviet leader's demand for dictatorial powers with her own call for a vote of no confidence. But only one-fourth of the 2,000 delegates in the Congress of People's Deputies -- mostly male apparatchiks -- voted with her; Mr. Gorbachev, ominously promising "discipline," prevailed.

headline.main: Bad Year for Women

snippet: Over the last decade, women running for Congress have raised on average more than their male counterparts, buoyed by an increase in female donors and the rise of small donations....
lead_paragraph: Over the last decade, women running for Congress have raised on average more than their male counterparts, buoyed by an increase in female donors and the rise of small donations.
abstract: Female Congressional candidates lagged behind their male counterparts in fund-raising for decades, largely because donors, mostly men, did not have faith in their ability to win; lately women running for Congress have raised on average more than male office seekers and substantially more in the Senate in election cycles when prominent women like Hillary Clinton and Elizabeth Warren are in the game.

lead_paragraph: LEAD: Antonia Coello Novello was confirmed as Surgeon General by the Senate on Thursday. A 45-year-old pediatrician and expert on AIDS in children, she is the first female and the first Hispanic Surgeon General. She has been deputy director of the National Institute of Child Health and Human Development, one of the National Institutes of Health.

snippet: A front-page article on Saturday about a decision by House and Senate negotiators to add an anti-abortion provision to a $388 billion spending bill referred incorrectly in some copies to the number of female senators who called for the measure to ...
lead_paragraph: A front-page article on Saturday about a decision by House and Senate negotiators to add an anti-abortion provision to a $388 billion spending bill referred incorrectly in some copies to the number of female senators who called for the measure to be changed because it had not gone through committee or to the Senate floor for a vote. It was nine, not eight.

snippet: A Senate committee vote has moved Congress one step closer to revoking an insulting law that makes servicewomen who are raped pay for their own abortions....
lead_paragraph: A Senate committee vote has moved Congress one step closer to revoking an insulting law that makes servicewomen who are raped pay for their own abortions.
abstract: Editorial applauds the Republican senators on the Armed Services Committee who joined nearly all the Democrats to lift law that requires female service members who are victims of rape or incest to pay for abortion care they receive at military facilities; contends the nine committee Republicans who voted against lifting the law are an example of how extreme their party's abortion politics have become.

abstract: Both Democratic and Republican women express disappointment in 2014 election results; of 15 women running for Senate, just four won, while House results show only incremental gains and number of female governors remains steady at five.

abstract: Op-Ed article by journalist and attorney Jill Filipovic expresses support for Rep Donna Edwards of Maryland, who after having lost Democratic primary for United States Senate seat to Rep Chris Van Hollen, called out hypocrisy of party that never elects black women yet relies heavily on black female voters; suggests Democratic Party should make concerted effort to elect more women across country, particularly minority women.

snippet: Republicans have not matched the rise of Democratic women, partly because moderate G.O.P. women are reluctant to run, research suggests....
lead_paragraph: Republicans have not matched the rise of Democratic women, partly because moderate G.O.P. women are reluctant to run, research suggests.
abstract: The Upshot; share of Democratic women in Congress is nearly 33 percent and continues to rise, while Republican female share has leveled off since reaching 10 percent during mid-2000s; research indicates moderate GOP women are hesitant to run.

headline.main: G.O.P. Women in Congress: Why So Few?
headline.print_headline: G.O.P. Women in Congress: Why So Few?
